bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of Gasterosteus aculeatus, the three spined stickleback, has been sequenced.

bioproject.title: A linkage map of the three spined stickleback is being developed at the Stanford Genome Evolution Center
bioproject.description: A genome wide linkage map for Gasterosteus aculeatus is being constructed at the Stanford Genome Evolution Center. From a lake in British Columbia, a benthic female was crossed to a limnetic male. A resulting F1 hybrid male was backcrossed to a benthic female to generate progeny used for large-scale genotyping analysis. Over 220 microsatellite markers have been analysed and placed on twenty-six initial linkage groups.

bioproject.title: Genome sequence for Danio rerio (zebrafish), currently maintained by the Genome Reference Consortium (GRC)
bioproject.description:
The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute began sequencing of the the 1.7 Gb zebrafish (Danio rerio) genome in 2001 using a combined approach of whole genome shotgun (WGS) sequencing with corresponding clone mapping and sequencing. The previous WGS project, CABZ00000000, is assembly WGS31 and represents the whole genome assembled from Illumina and Sanger shotgun reads. The latest project replaces WGS with high quality finished clone sequence, closing remaining gaps and placing yet unlocalized sequence.

The Genome Reference Consortium (GRC) has taken over maintenance of the zebrafish assembly. The goals of this group are to correct regions that are misrepresented, to close remaining gaps, and to produce alternative assemblies of structurally variant loci. The consortium does experimental work to address gaps or sub-optimal sequence regions and has developed the infrastructure to review and curate assembly joins. The GRC consists of: The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, The Genome Center at Washington University, The European Bioinformatics Institute and The National Center for Biotechnology Information. The public can see regions under review and report genome problems at the GRC website, http://genomereference.org.

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequencing for Mus musculus strain C57BL/6J
bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of the strain C57BL/6J was sequenced, in addition to other mouse strains.

bioproject.title: The Zebrafish Gene Collection (ZGC) aims to identify and sequence full-length Danio rerio clones.
bioproject.description: The Zebrafish Gene Collection (ZGC)is a Trans-NIH Zebrafish Initiative project to identify, sequence, and provide a community resource of cDNA clones containing a full-length open reading frame (FL-ORF). All clones generated by the ZGC are publicly accessible to the biomedical research community through the IMAGE Consortium distributors.

bioproject.title: Celera Genomics used whole genome shotgun sequencing to sequence the mouse genome
bioproject.description:
The Mus musculus genome was sequenced and annotated by Celera Genomics to study the evolution of different mammalian species. The combined whole genome shotgun assembly was deposited in Genbank under the WGS project accession AAHY00000000.

This assembly contains 27 million Celera reads on four Mus musculus strains (129X1/SvJ, 129S1/SvImJ, DBA/2J and A/J), 13 million reads on C57BL/6 from the NCBI Trace Archive, 0.4 million BAC end sequences from TIGR, and unfinished and finished BACs pulled from NCBI. The assembly process relied on Celera's paired reads and BAC end reads for long range order and orientation. Its scaffolds were mapped to chromosomes using STS maps.

bioproject.title: The National Institute on Aging is making a catalog of mouse cDNAs, representing approximately 39000 unique transcripts
bioproject.description: The National Institute on Aging is making a catalog of mouse genes expressed in embryonic and adult stem cells, and early embryos, representing approximately 39000 unique transcripts. The cDNA libraries, enriched in full-length clones, were condensed into the NIA 15 and 7.4K clone sets. These libraries are freely distributed to the research community, providing a standard platform for expression studies using microarrays. They are important tools for studying mammalian development and stem cell biology.

bioproject.title: BAC end sequencing project
bioproject.description: TIGR will sequence from the ends of 170,634 bacterial artificial chromosome (BAC) clones from the entire library RPCI-23. 130,000 clones from library RPCI-24 will be generated to provide highly specific markers to complement the current genome.

bioproject.title: mitochondrial genome sequencing project
bioproject.description: Mitochondrial genome of Arabidopsis has been completely sequenced. Sequencing was done at the Institut fur Genbiologische Forschung, Berlin, Germany
bioproject.organization: Institut fuer Genbiologische Forschung GmbH, Berlin

bioproject.title: Paramecium aurelia
bioproject.organization: University of Colorado Health Science Center

bioproject.title: The mitochondrial genome of Caenorhabditis elegans has been sequenced
bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of Caenorhabditis elegans has been sequenced at The University of Utah.

bioproject.title: Didelphis virginiana

bioproject.title: unicellular, colorless algae, mitochondria completely sequenced
bioproject.description:
Prototheca is a genus of unicellular, colorless and heterotrophic alga. It is found in manure, sewage, soil and water. They grow rapidly in high humidity It is placed in the same order as Chlorella because of its morphological and ultrastructural resemblance to the green photosynthetic members of this order. One species of Prototheca is a human and animal pathogen.

P. wickerhamii is found in soil. They are round and lack flagella. Mitochondrial DNA of this species has been sequenced. Sequence analysis suggests that it is related to higher plant mtDNA more than to mtDNA of chlorophyte alga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii.
bioproject.organization: Gertraud Burger, Universite de Montreal, Biochimie, 2900 Blvd. Eduard Montpetit, Montreal, Quebec H3T 1J4, Canada

bioproject.title: Complete sequence of C. reinhardtii mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of C. reinhardtii has been completely sequenced. It is a linear double stranded molecule, 15.8 kb in size. It has about 230 bp inverted repeats at the end. Most other mitochondrial genomes from diverse green algal lineages are circular DNA molecules.

bioproject.title: The mitochondrial genome of the chimpanzee has been sequenced
bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of the chimpanzee has been sequenced.

bioproject.title: Pan paniscus complete mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: Bonobo mitochondrial genome

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by National Institute of Genetics, Japan
bioproject.description: The National Institute of Genetics, Japan has sequenced the mitochondrial genome of a Western gorilla, Gorilla gorilla.

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by National Institute of Genetics, Japan
Mitochondrial genome of marine seaweed Chondrus crispus
bioproject.description:
Chondrus crispus is a common marine seaweed found in both European and the Atlantic North American intertidal coastline. It appears like a low bushy plant which, when reproductive, may have small bumps near the tips. It appears in variety of forms and colours. The color varies from dark red to green and yellow or white depending on the sunlight and availability of nutrients. They are highly stress tolerant. Cell wall of C. crispus is rich in carrageenan, a mucopolysaccharide, which is used as thickener in food products.

Mitochondria of C. crispus has been completely sequenced using DNA isolated from female gametophytic tissue. It is a circular molecule of 25,836 nucleotides, with an overall A + T content of 72.1%. It has high coding density with 51 genes identified.

bioproject.title: sequence of the migratory locust mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete sequence of the Locusta migratoria mitochondrial genome was determined at the Zoologisches Institut der Universitat Basel, Switzerland. The gene content and organization are similar to the mitochondrial genome of Drosophila yakuba except for a rearrangement of the two tRNA genes.
bioproject.organization: Zoologisches Institut der Univ. Basel, Switzerland

bioproject.title: Sequencing and annotation of the complete mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The Universite de Montreal, Canada sequenced and annotated the complete mitochondrial genome of Allomyces macrogynus strain ATCC 46923.

bioproject.title: Mitochondrial genome sequence of the rainbow trout
bioproject.description: The nucleotide sequence of the mitochondrial DNA of the rainbow trout, Onchorynchus mykiss, was determined. The organization of the mitochondrial genome was the same as described in most species, with a total length of 16,660 bp.

bioproject.title: Oryza sativa Japonica group mitochondrial plasmid B1
bioproject.description: Complete nucleotide sequence of B1 plasmid-like DNA, present in the mitochondria of rice have been sequenced at the Kyoto University, Japan.

bioproject.title: Latimeria chalumnae RefSeq Genome
bioproject.description: The reference sequence (RefSeq) genome assembly is provided by NCBI using sequence and assembly instructions provided by the Broad Institute and annotated using NCBI's genome annotation pipeline.

bioproject.title: Cepaea nemoralis
bioproject.organization: The Natural History Museum, Department of Zoology, UK

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequencing by University of Lund, Sweden
The mitochondrial genome for this protist has been sequenced and published
bioproject.description: The protist, Reclinomonas americana, has had its mitochondrial genome sequenced and published. It has been used for mitochondrial evolution studies.
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.title: Chlamydomonas moewusii mitochondria
bioproject.description:
Chlamydomonas is a genus of unicellular green algae found widely in fresh water, on damp soil, and a few occur in the sea. The cells are spherical or ellipsoidal. They have two equal flagella, present at the anterior end of the cell. The cell is surrounded by a fibrous glycoprotein cell wall.

Chlamydomonas eugametos, is a commonly used laboratory species for the study of molecular genetics and photosynthesis. Complete sequence of its mitochondrial genome has been determined. It is 22,897 bp circular molecule as compared to the 15.8 kb linear mtDNA of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii. They do share almost the same reduced set of coding functions but exhibit several differences, like, completely different gene order, presence of an additional gene for tRNA(met) that may be a pseudogene, transcription of all genes from the same mtDNA strand, a lower G + C content, less pronounced bias in codon usage and the absence of a reverse transcriptase-like gene homologue.

bioproject.title: Balanoglossus carnosus
bioproject.organization: University of Munich, Institute of Zoology, Germany

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by University of Lund, Sweden
Pelomedusa subrufa
bioproject.organization: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales, Spain

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by University of Greenwich, London
Mitochondrial DNA of Porphyra purpurea has been completely sequenced.
bioproject.description: Mitochondrial DNA of Porphyra purpurea has been completely sequenced. It is a circular genome, 36,753 bp in size. Two copies of a 219 nucleotide long inverted repeat lie approximately opposite one another. A total of 57 densely packed genes have been identified, which include genes commonly found in other mitochondrial genomes and seven genes characteristic of protist and plant mtDNAs.
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.title: Sequencing of the mitochondrial linear plasmid Harbin-3
bioproject.description: The University of British Columbia determined the complete nucleotide sequence of the mitochondrial linear plasmid Harbin-3 from Neurospora intermedia strain 3983.

Gadus morhua

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by University of Lund, Sweden
bioproject.description: The University of Lund in Sweden sequenced the mitochondrial genome of Pongo abelii, the Sumatran orangutan, and compared its sequence with that of the Bornean orangutan, Pongo pygmaeus. The Sumatran and Bornean orangutans were previously considered subspecies of the orangutan, Pongo pygmaeus. Comparison of the mitochondrial genome sequences from Sumatran and Bornean orangutans suggests that the two orangutans should be recognized as two different species.

bioproject.title: Sequence of the mediterranean fruit fly mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete sequence of the Medfly Ceratitis capitata mitochondrial genome was sequenced at the Institute of Molecular Biology and Biotechnology at the Foundation for Research and Technology-Hellas in Greece. An analysis of the sequence was published by Spanos et al. in 2000. The C. capitata mitochondrial genome encodes 13 proteins involved in oxidative phosphorylation, 22 transfer RNAs and 2 ribosomal RNAs. The genes are arranged in the same locations and orientations as in the Drosophila yakuba mitochondrial genome. Several sequence polymorphisms were identified that may be useful in distinguishing different Medfly strains.

bioproject.title: Tetrahymena pyriformis
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequenced by University of Lund, Sweden
Mustelus manazo
bioproject.organization: The Institute of Statistical Mathematics, Japan

bioproject.title: Tiny chlorophytes, thought to include descendants of the earliest diverging green algae
bioproject.description:
Pedinomonas are tiny chlorophytes less than 10 mkm in length. They possess a laterally inserted flagellum. It is thought to include descendants of first primitive chlorophytes.

The mitochondrial genome of Pedinomonas minor has been sequenced. It is a small, circular, 25,137-bp genome containing 22 genes. In gene content and rate of sequence divergence P. minor mtDNA resembles the reduced mtDNAs of chlamydomonad algae.
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.title: Amblyraja radiata
bioproject.organization: Division of Evolutionary Molecular Systematics, Genetics, Sweden

bioproject.title: Sequencing and annotation of the mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: Sequence and organizational analysis of the 55,564-bp mitochondrial genome of D. discoideum was done at the University of Tsukuba, Japan. All genes are encoded on the same strand of the mitochondrial DNA and a universal genetic code is used.

bioproject.title: Sequencing of the mitochondrial genome for strain ATCC 16981 (West Virginia 4)
bioproject.description: Sequencing of the mitochondrial genome for Phytophthora infestans strain ATCC 16981 (West Virginia 4) has been completed. This genome represents haplotype Ib.

bioproject.title: Chrysodidymus synuroideus
bioproject.description:
Chrysodidymus synuroideus is a single known species of genus Chrysodidymus. It is a unicellular organism with cells 5-10 mkm in length. It is found in acidic bogs in Asia, Australia and the Americas. The cells are covered with delicately-sculptured scales that are made of amorphous silica. They are usually found in pairs, interpreted as two-celled colonies. Cells range from ovate to narrowly ellipsoidal. Each cell has two flagella of unequal length at the anterior end. They contain one centrally-located nucleus and, usually, two plate-like, parietal, golden-colored chloroplasts that do not contain pyrenoids. Cells in stationary phase may develop a reddish pigmentation.

The mitochondrial genome of Chrysodidymus synuroideus has been sequenced. It is 34,119 bp circular molecule that contains 58 genes. The gene sequence has been analyzed and used to compare with mitochondria from other photosynthetic and non-photosynthetic stramenopiles.
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.organization: Tokyo University of Pharmacy and Life Science, Japan

bioproject.description: The complete 6 kb mitochondrial genome of Plasmodium reichenowi was sequenced and used in comparative studies with P. falciparum, analyzing polymorphism and divergence in these two closely related species.
bioproject.organization: Department of Infectious and Tropical Diseases, London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

bioproject.title: Paragonimus westermani
bioproject.organization: Kochi Medical School, Department of Environmental Health Science, Japan

bioproject.title: Sequencing of the domestic silkworm mitochondrial genome, Backokjam strain
bioproject.description: The complete genome of the B. mori mitochondrion from the Backokjam strain was sequenced by the Genome Analysis Team at the Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology (KRIBB). Studies undertaken to compare the levels of sequence divergence and gene rearrangements between the domestic silkmoth (B. mori) and the closely-related wild mulberry silkmoth (B. mandarina) were published by Yukuhiro, et al. in 2002. The Backojam strain contains 12 mismatches and 13 insertions or deletions relative to the C-108 strain.
bioproject.organization: Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology

bioproject.title: Plasmodium falciparum NF54  complete mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete 6 kb mitochondrial genome of Plasmodium falciparum was sequenced from four different cultured isolates and aligned with previously derived P. falciparum sequences. It was shown that there was an extremely low synonymous nucleotide polymorphism in P. falciparum, suggesting a recent emergence from a single ancestral population.
bioproject.organization: Department of Infectious and Tropical Diseases, London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

bioproject.description: Mitochondrial genome for B. vulgaris has been sequenced at the Laboratory of Genetic Engineering, Graduate School of Agriculture, Hokkaido University, Japan. It is 368,799 bp in size and contains 29 protein coding genes.

bioproject.title: Rhodomonas salina
bioproject.description:
Rhodomonas salina belongs to the phylum Cryptophyta which consists of small phytoflagellates. Each flagellate cell bears two flagella, which differ in length. The cells are dorsiventrally constructed, the dorsal side is convex and the ventral side is flat. The chloroplast is variously colored due to a variety of photosynthetic pigments. R. salina is found in marine environments and bears red plastids. It is being used as a model organism for algal studies related to toxicity and also evolution.

The mitochondria of R. salina has been completely sequenced. It is a circular genome of 48,063 bp and codes for 64 genes. Intergenic regions, when present, are A-rich.
bioproject.organization: Universite de Montreal, Departement de Biochimie, Canada

bioproject.title: The mitochondrial genome of this protist has been sequenced
bioproject.description: The mitochondrial genome of this protist, Naegleria gruberi, has been sequenced.

bioproject.title: mitochondrial genome sequence of the Chagas disease vector, Triatoma dimidiata
bioproject.description: The complete sequence of the Triatoma dimidiata mitochondrial genome was determined at the Centers for Disease Control. The mitochondrial genome is typical of insects. It encodes 13 proteins involved in oxidative phosphorylation, 22 transfer RNAs and 2 ribosomal RNAs.
bioproject.organization: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, NCID/DPD/Entomology Branch, USA

sequence of the wallaby louse mitochondrial genome

The mitochondrial genome encodes the 37 genes typical of animals, but has extensive gene rearrangements in comparison to other insects. Comparisons to the mitochondrial genomes of other species of lice and hemipteroid insects will be useful in understanding their phylogenetic relationships.

bioproject.title: brown, photosynthetic, filamentous alga
bioproject.description:
Pylaiella littoralis is a small bushy filamentous alga of the order Ectocarpales which are considered as the ancestral group for all other brown algae. These are brown, photosynthetic and filamentous algae where the thallus is composed of uniseriate filaments. They are diplohaplontic, having a haploid and diploid generations. They exhibit simple cytological characteristics consisting of peripheral plastids and a central nucleus.

In order to understand the evolution of the mitochondrial genomes, mitochondria of P. littoralis has been completely sequenced. It showed the presence of several alpha-proteobacterial characteristics and the presence of several other rarer genes.

bioproject.title: The red flour beetle mitochondrial genome encodes 13 putative proteins, 2 ribosomal RNAs and 22 tRNAs
bioproject.description: Sequencing of the 15,881 bp T. castaneum mitochondrial genome represents the first complete mitochondrial genome in the insect order Coleoptera. Comparison with the mitochondrion of the fruit fly and other organisms allows for both comaparative genomics and phylogenetic analysis.

bioproject.description: The complete coding region of the Ostrinia nubilalis mitochondrial genome was sequenced at Iowa State University by Coates et al. (2005). The sequence shows an identical gene order to the lepidopteran Bombyx mori and 1.3% sequence divergence from the asian corn borer O. furnicalis.

bioproject.title: Sequence of the asian corn borer mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete coding region of the Ostrinia furnicalis mitochondrial genome was sequenced at Iowa State University by Coates et al. (2005). The sequence shows an identical gene order to the lepidopteran Bombyx mori and 1.3% sequence divergence from the european corn borer O. nubilalis.

bioproject.title: sequence of the spotted asparagus beetle mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete sequence of the Crioceris duodecimpunctata mitochondrial genome was determined at Simon Fraser University, Canada. The mitochondrial genome is typical of insects. It encodes 13 proteins involved in oxidative phosphorylation, 22 transfer RNAs and 2 ribosomal RNAs. Complete mitochondrial sequences from a broader array of insects will be useful to clarify their early phylogenetic relationships.

bioproject.title: Complete mitochondrial genome sequence of Trichoderma reesei (aka Hypocrea jecorina)
bioproject.description: The University of Sao Paulo determined the complete nucleotide sequence of the Trichoderma reesei strain QM9414 mitochondrial genome.

bioproject.title: Sequence of the wild mulberry silkmoth mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete mitochondrial (mt) genome sequence of Bombyx mandarina, the probable wild ancestor of the domesticated silkmoth, was determined at the National Institute of Agrobiological Sciences, Japan. The mt genome has a gene content and order typical of insects, with a single translocation relative to the mt genome of Drosophila yakuba, which is thought to represent the gene order of the ancestral insect. Large amounts of sequence divergence between the mt genomes of B. mandarina and its domesticated relative, B. mori, suggest that the two species were genetically isolated from each other approximately 7.1 million years ago.
bioproject.organization: National Institute of Agrobiological Sciences, Japan

bioproject.title: Economically important brown seaweed
bioproject.description:
Laminaria is a genus of multicellular brown seaweed commonly called kelp. They are found through out the world and are the most productive habitats in the marine environment. They grow rapidly, some species can grow 30 cm per day. They have a haplodiplophasic life cycle alternating between a microscopic filamentous gametophyte and a macroscopic sporophyte, which can reach several meters in length depending on the species. The kelp sporophytes are economically important and are cultivated in East Asia. It is used for the production of algin, a gel forming polysaccharide used in a large variety of pharmaceutical, food, and industrial application.

Mitochondrial genome of Laminaria digitata has been sequenced by Oudot et al..

bioproject.title: Chaetosphaeridium globosum
bioproject.description:
Chaetosphaeridium is a genus of small, unicellular, freshwater chlorophyte. The cells are ovoid or spherical and can be found in groups forming branched filaments that are connected by hyaline tubes. Each cell has a parietal chloroplast, which contains a pyrenoid, and it bears a long hair like structure that is formed by extension of the cell wall that has a basal sheath. Oogamous reproduction has been reported and asexual reproduction is by the formation of biflagellate zoospores. Chaetosphaeridium belongs to the order Choleochaetales which has great evolutionary and environmental importance as it has often been thought of as the group closest to the land plants.

Mitochondrial and chloroplast genome of Chaetosphaeridium globosum has been fully sequenced in order to understand the evolution of organelle genomes in Streptophyta. Chloroplast DNA (131,183 bp) was found to be strikingly similar to land-plant DNA in terms of gene content (124 genes), intron composition (18 introns), and gene order, while the mitochondrial DNA (56,574 bp) was found to be more compact than land plants and featured differences at the levels of size, intron composition (11 introns), and gene order.

bioproject.title: sequence of the plague thrips mitochondrial genome
bioproject.description: The complete sequence of the Thrips imaginis mitochondrial genome was determined at the University of Queensland, Brisbane. The mitochondrial genome encodes the 37 genes typical of animals, but has extensive gene rearrangements and other unusual features in comparison to other insects. Comparisons to the mitochondrial genomes of other species helped to determine the phylogeny of the orders Thysanoptera and Psocoptera (Shao et al. 2001).
